Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Influenza \In`flu*en"za\, n. [It. influenza influence, an epidemic formerly attributed by astrologers to the influence of the heavenly bodies, influenza. See {Influence}.] (Med.) An epidemic viral infectious disease characterized by acute nasal catarrh, or by inflammation of the throat or the bronchi, and usually accompanied by fever and general weakness; also called {grippe}. It is caused by several forms of RNA virus which mutate readily and thereby render vaccines prepared against older forms ineffective, often requiring a new form of vaccine for each new outbreak. [1913 Webster +PJC]
influenza n : an acute febrile highly contagious viral disease [syn: {flu}, {grippe}]
